title: SHO energy - U-vs-x graph - find new x

content.question: A <math alttext="2.0 kilograms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mtext>.</mtext><mn>0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></math> block attached to a horizontal spring oscillates in simple harmonic motion in the horizontal direction. Friction is negligible, so the spring exerts the only horizontal force on the block. The graph shows the spring’s potential energy <math alttext="U" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>U</mi></math> as a function of the block’s position <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math>. The block’s motion may or may not include positions outside the range shown in the graph. The speed of the block is <math alttext="3.0 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn><mtext>.</mtext><mn>0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>s</mtext></math> when the block is at <math alttext="x equals 0.70 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn><mtext>.</mtext><mn>70</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></math>. At which of the following positions is the speed of the block most nearly equal to <math alttext="4.0 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><mtext>.</mtext><mn>0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>s</mtext></math> ?

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
